lexUnit.name: smash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hit or collide with forcefully.

sentence.text: Something smashed hard against the door from the other side .
It was the sort of movement that was music to England manager Graham Taylor but the 25-goal striker , recovered from groin trouble , was denied as his shot smashed against the legs of Schmeichel .
Whatever the reason , Toks ' tighthead failed to get down and his head smashed against his opposition 's shoulder .
He had fallen badly , his head smashing against the chipped sink with enough force to crack his skull like a breakfast egg .
All the time the tide was coming and now was smashing against the wave breakers , but here came a big wave .
The truck smashed into the barrier , broke through it , lurched down an embankment .
A cloud of metal , glass and debris smashed into the car , whirled inside momentarily and was sucked out again .
A car smashed into her rear end as she dithered over which direction to take .
The bullet smashed into the nearest keg .
The T-Rex singer was 29 when his car smashed into the tree 15 years ago .
A PASSENGER train smashed into a truck on a level crossing near Lisbon killing the train driver and injuring about 30 passengers .
The lorry smashed through a brick wall and plunged into the fast-flowing canal , landing on its side .
The double-decker smashed through a fence and ended up perched precariously on a bridge parapet at Brighouse , West Yorkshire .
It appeared to be coming from somewhere to the right , the bullets were hitting the house high up and smashing through the windows of one of the bedrooms .
But as she did so , a crushing weight smashed across her skull .
FIVE men were killed and two seriously injured when two vans smashed head-on yesterday .
